channel.title: Amazing WWII photos. Must see
channel.description:
America Vs. Japan:
December 7, 1941: Sailors stand among wrecked airplanes at Ford Island Naval Air Station as they watch the explosion of the USS Shaw in the background, during the Japanese surprise attack on Pearl Harbor, Hawaii. (AP Photo)
[img]http://denverpost.slideshowpro.com/albums/001/496/album-101361/cache/pacific003.sJPG_950_2000_0_75_0_50_50.sJPG?1270902982[/img]
November 1944: Ground crew members prepare bombs to be loaded into the racks of the waiting B-29 Superforts, at a U.S. airbase on Saipan, in the Mariana Islands. (AP Photo)
[img]http://denverpost.slideshowpro.com/albums/001/496/album-101361/cache/pacific070.sJPG_950_2000_0_75_0_50_50.sJPG?1270902985[/img]
July 1944: U.S. Army reinforcement troops are seen as they disembark from LST's in the background and proceed across the coral reef toward Saipan beach, Mariana Islands. (AP Photo)
[img]http://denverpost.slideshowpro.com/albums/001/496/album-101361/cache/pacific060.sJPG_950_2000_0_75_0_50_50.sJPG?1270902985[/img]
September 2, 1945: F4U and F6F fighter planes are flying in formation over the USS Missouri, while the surrender ceremonies to end World War II take place aboard the U.S. Navy battleship. (AP Photo)
[img]http://denverpost.slideshowpro.com/albums/001/496/album-101361/cache/pacific108.sJPG_950_2000_0_75_0_50_50.sJPG?1270902987[/img] Rest of the 110 images: http://blogs.denverpost.com/captured/2010/03/18/captured-blog-the-pacific-and-adjacent-theaters/#more-1547 Oh and don't turn this into a debate about Hiroshima.

item.title: Amazing WWII photos. Must see
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

[quote=“marluxia, post:7, topic:336376”][quote author=cooper link=topic=432746.msg3176970#msg3176970 date=1270945118]
My favourite WWII picture:

[/quote]

lol did u know that the soviets doctored that photo to hide the fact the soldier holding the flag has two watches (meaning he stole one)? Infact I think I heard that fun fact here :P?[/quote]
Yeah, I knew about that :P. They also added the smoke to make it more dramatic.
Originals:


Bigger:

Read full topic

item.title: Amazing WWII photos. Must see
item.dc:creator: @PeterMan PeterMan
item.description:
@PeterMan wrote:

I’ve always been interested in WW2. Thanks for the link, really interesting.

BloodRayne:

I downloaded the WWII in HD series that runs on the history channel, they have a lot of clips that look like they were taken at the time those pictures were, almost as if those are frames from the videos. If you like these pictures I recommend you watch it

Thanks, gonna go ahead and download that.

Read full topic

Its amazing what really went on in that war. Great pictures to, i’ve always been interested in ww2.
